title: Montreal R User Group: Spark NLP for Healthcare Data Scientists Virtual Training
description:
Must register here to attend: https://bit.ly/2WbgPv6

Many critical facts required by healthcare AI applications – like patient risk prediction, cohort selection, automated clinical coding, and clinical decision support—are locked in unstructured free-text data. Recent advances in deep learning have raised the bar on achievable accuracy for tasks like named entity recognition, assertion status detection, entity resolution, deidentification, and others.

Spark NLP for Healthcare provides production-grade, scalable, and trainable implementation of novel healthcare-specific natural language processing (NLP) algorithms and models. The product is licensed by John Snow Labs, the creator of Spark NLP, and provides data scientists with a library and pre-trained models for the most common medical NLP tasks. This is a hands-on workshop that will enable you to write, edit, and run Python notebooks that use the product’s functionality.

The workshop is organized in three hour-long sessions, each followed by 30 minutes of self-guided coding, on Python notebooks relevant to each section. This is a live online workshop and the instructors will be available during the self-guided sessions to answer questions.

This workshop is part of the recommended preparation for the “Certified Spark NLP Healthcare Data Scientist” certification exam.

Register here >> https://bit.ly/2WbgPv6

title: Montreal R User Group: Hitachi Vantara DataOps.NEXT Virtual Conference
description:
Register here: https://bit.ly/2xP8R29

Hitachi Vantara is hosting the DataOps.NEXT virtual conference on May 14th, 2020 to help you discover ways to solve your complex data management issues across your entire data lifecycle – data onboarding and preparation, governance and agility, analytics and machine learning, and data fabric optimization. Join this virtual conference to listen to over 30 industry experts sharing fresh and practical insights.

You will learn how to tackle some of the most difficult data management and analytics challenges with real-life customer examples and expert insights on:

● Analytics and machine learning
● Data fabric optimization
● Data onboarding and preparation
● Governance and agility

Register: https://bit.ly/2xP8R29

title: Montreal R User Group: [Webinar] Rapidly Onboard and Prep Your Data for Machine Learning
description:
Register here: https://bit.ly/2Wgs1rG

Building machine learning models is a creative process that requires deep thinking and expertise. But there's a lot of drudgery required to find and prep the data to train your ML model, not to mention getting that model into production or re-training it later.

Whether you're using H2O.ai, Spark MLlib or any other machine learning framework, building your ML model is just one step in the longer process of getting machine learning into production.

Join Infoworks and Databricks at this live webinar for discussion and demo on how to:

- Find and prep the data to train your ML model in hours instead of days
- Easily integrate the data with ML environments such as Databricks Notebooks
- Get an ML model into production more quickly
- Re-train the model with a push of the button

Register here to attend: https://bit.ly/2Wgs1rG

title: Greater Cleveland R Group: Virtual R Café
description:
This is a chance to hang out with other R coders for a bit. It will be informal with no set topic. Bring something to work on and feel free to share or ask questions if want.

If you want an idea to work on, you could look at the kaggle housing price data from our last meeting (https://www.kaggle.com/c/house-prices-advanced-regression-techniques). See some of the groups code for this at https://github.com/ClevelandRUserGroup/RTalksMarch2020.

title: Greater Cleveland R Group: Rami Krispin on Covid19 Data Project
description:
Rami's Abstract: The goal of the Covid19R project is to create a uniform and tidy data format and set standards for Covid19 data in R. This enables the users to load to R seamlessly a clean, ready to use, and up-to-date covid19 dataset. The project currently includes several datasets such as covid19france, covid19nytimes, covid19swiss. In this talk, I will focus on approaches for building supporting tools in R for Covid19 data with the use of APIs, continuous integration with Github Actions, dashboards, visualization. More details about the project are available here: https://github.com/Covid19R

Bio: Rami Krispin is a data scientist who mainly focuses on time series analysis and forecasting applications. He is the author of "Hands-On Time Series Analysis with R", and several R packages, including the TSstudio package for time series analysis and forecasting applications. Since the beginning of the covid19 outbreak, he wrote R dataset packages and created dashboards for tracking the outbreak (such as coronavirus, covid19italy, etc.)

title: R User Group - Philippines: #76 Using R to study Epidemiological Metrics
description:
We welcome back as speaker Dr. Peter Julian Cayton from UP School of Statistics, who had also been working hard alongside the UP COVID-19 Pandemic Response Team the past few weeks.

The presentation will discuss the measures used and devised by the UP COVID-19 Pandemic Response Team to monitor the pandemic situation in the country. They involve the following statistics: cumulative plots, percent changes, implied doubling times, and recovery rates. Epidemiology-specific measures will also be discussed, which are: 1) the time-varying reproduction number Rt, and 2) outbreak threshold statistics, along with a few dashboards.

The talk will focus on the approach, but also showing how R functions help us study Rt.

title: Salt Lake City R Users Group: [Online] Regression When Your Data Isn't Well Behaved
group: Salt Lake City R Users Group
description:
Our May Meetup will be a remote gathering. Look for the Zoom link to be posted the week of the event!

The most commonly taught types of regression are linear (where the dependent variable can be any real number) and logistic (where the dependent variable is binary). However, many types of data don't fall into either of these two categories. In this session, we will review regression techniques that can handle other kinds of inputs: censored normal, logit-normal, and beta regression (for dependent variables that are bounded above and/or below); ordered logistic regression (for multiple discrete outcomes that are logically ordered, such as Likert ratings); and multinomial logistic regression (for discrete outcomes that aren't ordered). These techniques provide a better representation of the processes they are modeling and allow us to make more realistic predictions.

Abby Kaplan is a data scientist at Salt Lake Community College. Before joining SLCC, she was an adjunct professor of linguistics at the University of Utah. She received her PhD in linguistics from UC Santa Cruz in 2010.

title: Oslo useR! Group: [Workshop] Mild introduction to Structural Equation Modeling
description:
When working with data, we often want to create models to predict future events, but we also want an even deeper understanding of how our data is causally connected or structured. In this workshop, we will explore the connectedness of data using structural equation modeling (SEM) with the {lavaan} package.

If you want to actively follow the workshop, please have the R packages {lavaan} and {semPlot} installed. Because of the virtual format of the workshop, we will only have very limited capacities for helping with troubleshooting.

The speaker, Ronny Scherer, received his PhD from Humboldt-Universität zu Berlin in 2012, and is currently working at the Centre for Educational Measurement, University of Oslo (CEMO). His research and teaching cover structural equation modeling, meta-analysis, computer-based assessments, and multilevel analysis. Ronny is coordinating the Measurement Models course at CEMO.

We look forward seeing all of you!

title: Saint Louis R User Group: Statistics in Sports with R
description:
This meetup will only be available online. The presentation will start shortly after 6pm, not 6:30 like our in-person meetups.

By: John Snyder

Big data in sports provide a unique and challenging opportunity for advanced statistical analysis and creative data exploration. Extensive data are being collected on athletes, teams, and their opponents. These data are being used in many ways, from individual player evaluation to assisting in strategy development.

This month, I will demonstrate two examples on public datasets. First, the MLBs Statcast dataset will be used to explore home run probability as a function a baseball's launch angle and velocity off the bat. Additionally, a basketball dataset will be explored.

title: Wiesbaden R User Group: R Coffee Break - Parallelisierung in R
description:
Hallo liebe R User,

Corona ist in aller Munde und wahrscheinlich ist fast jede/r von uns irgendwie betroffen. Viele von uns sind im Home-Office und Veranstaltungen wie Vorträge fallen aufgrund der Maßnahmen aus.

Es wird also Zeit für ein neues Format: Die R Coffee Break, in der wir euch in einem 5-10 minütigem Vortrag ein Thema vorstellen wollen. Das Ganze natürlich online über Zoom.
Und ganz wie die gepflegte Kaffeepause im Büro wird das Meetup am Nachmittag stattfinden und insgesamt nicht länger als 15 Minuten in Anspruch nehmen.

In diesem Coffee Break beschäftigen wir uns mit Möglichkeiten zur parallelen Prozessierung in R. Welche Optionen gibt es und wann macht Parallelisierung Sinn? Wir schauen uns ein wenig den theoretischen Hintergrund an und betrachten dann ein typisches Anwendungsbeispiel.

Wir freuen uns schon darauf euch auch bei diesem Meetup begrüßen zu dürfen. Die Zugangsdaten werden am Tag des Vortrags ab 12 Uhr hier bereitgestellt.

title: Melbourne Users of R Network (MelbURN): Using Googleway and Leaflet to visualise predicted travel time differences
description:
Another great talk lined up for R users! If you're into maps, visualizations and prediction being used in the real world, then you don't want to miss this talk.

This will be an on-line meetup, see Zoom details below.

Talk info:
Using Googleway and Leaflet to visualise predicted travel time differences between transport modes

Belinda will talk about a proof of concept map she developed in R to illustrate transport mode choices by area in Melbourne.

If you could drive to work in 10 minutes, but it would take you 40 minutes by public transport, which would you choose?

Belinda wanted to illustrate the data behind a choice which people make every day: the choice between driving and taking public transport. This talk will cover calculating a set of journey origin points, querying and manipulating travel time predictions from these points using the Googleway package (a Google Maps API wrapper) and mapping the output using Leaflet.

Belinda has previously presented to R-Ladies Melbourne on her Leaflet public transport network visualisation work at PTV: https://www.meetup.com/rladies-melbourne/events/247262918/ http://about.me/minga

Bio:
Belinda Maher started her journey in transport data a decade ago at KiwiRail, where she worked on a $2 billion NZD upgrade of Auckland's suburban train network. After returning home to Melbourne, she took up a role at Public Transport Victoria in Operational Performance Analysis.

She now works in Network Planning at the Department of Transport (DoT) where she is involved in data-driven planning and data visualisation (including mapping).

At DoT, Belinda has worked on projects including analysing observed tram speeds across the network for on-road priority planning, and also on collating and mapping data about current and future train stations for strategic planning.

title: New York Open Statistical Programming Meetup: The Covid19R Project [Remote Only]
group: New York Open Statistical Programming Meetup
description:
Once again we have a special remote meetup and once again it is about COVID-19.

Due to COVID-19 there is no in-person component to this meetup but rather it will take place completely online at https://zoom.us/j/93011906605. Thank you to EcoHealth Alliance for providing the Zoom link.

Even though we will not be in person to have pizza together, that has long been a central part of the meetup. So Scott's Pizza Tours is sponsoring the meetup this month and offering everyone 25% off virtual tours booked by June 1. Use code NerdsLovePizza at https://www.scottspizzatours.com/ for the discount.

About the Talk:
The Covid19R project provides a set of tools and common language for developing covid19 dataset related R packages in a tidy format. The main goal of the project is to create a data structure standard that enables the users to load to R seamlessly a clean, ready to use, and up-to-date covid19 dataset. The project currently includes several dataset packages such as covid19france, covid19nytimes, covid19swiss, and the covid19R package that enable fast access for several data sources in a tidy format. In this talk, I will focus on approaches for creating a covid19 R dataset package and supporting elements such as dashboard, visualization, and automation with continuous integration tools. More details about the project are available here: https://github.com/Covid19R

About Rami:
Rami Krispin is a data scientist who mainly focuses on time series analysis and forecasting applications. He is the author of "Hands-On Time Series Analysis with R", and several R packages, including the TSstudio package for time series analysis and forecasting applications. Since the beginning of the covid19 outbreak, he wrote R dataset packages and created dashboards for tracking the outbreak (such as coronavirus, covid19italy, etc.)

The meetup will start right at 7 and we will start admitting people to the meeting shortly before. Since this is completely remote there will be no pizza but everyone is encouraged to have pizza individually.

title: R-Ladies Santiago: Taller introductorio: procesamiento y visualización de datos con R (Sesión 2)
description:
El miércoles 13 de mayo continuamos nuestro taller en línea de introducción a R que organizamos en conjunto RLadies Santiago, RLadies Valparaíso y RLadies Concepción. El taller cuatro sesiones (6, 13, 20 y 27 de mayo) y tiene por objetivo revisar los principios básicos para que puedas iniciar tu camino analizando datos con R.
¿Quieres aprender a utilizar R en un ambiente amable e inclusivo? ¡Te esperamos! No es necesario tener ningún conocimiento previo sobre programación.

Esta segunda sesión estará a cargo de Sara Acevedo, estudiante de Doctorado en Ciencias de la Ingeniería, y se enfocará en funciones básicas para el manejo de datos provenientes del paquete {dplyr}.

> ¿Qué necesito para participar?

Lo primero, es leer nuestro nuestro código de conducta. Es requisito para asistir estar de acuerdo con él: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct#spanish
Lo segundo, es crearte una cuenta en RStudio Cloud (https://rstudio.cloud/). Partiremos trabajando en una versión de R en la nube para asegurarnos que todo funciona bien al principio. Más adelante instalaremos R en tu computador.
Lo tercero, es asegurarte que puedes utilizar la aplicación Zoom en tu computador. El día del taller te enviaremos el enlace para unirte (chequea ese día que el mensaje no se haya ido a la carpeta de spam).
El taller tiene cupos limitados por la plataforma que usaremos y se asignarán por orden de llegada a las personas inscritas. Te pedimos disculpas desde ya si es que el día del taller tratas de conectarte y los cupos ya están llenos :( Es muy difícil estimar la audiencia real en eventos gratuitos.

> ¿Al inscribirme ahora me estoy anotando para las cuatro sesiones?

No. Agendaremos un nuevo evento acá en Meetup para cada sesión. Lo hacemos así porque nos permite organizarnos mejor.

¡Te esperamos!

title: R-Ladies Philly: A/B Testing in R - Virtual Event
description:
A/B testing is a simple controlled experiment conducted in user experience research as part of marketing research. The randomized experiment consists of variants A and B where a change in one can influence the user experience in a measurable way. It is similar to a two sample hypothesis test. This virtual tutorial demonstrates how to conduct A/B testing in R. The tutorial will cover parts 1-3 of the Advanced A/B Testing Workshop by Elea McDonnell Feit.

Tutorial parts 1- 3:
(https://eleafeit.github.io/ab_test/)
1- Introduction
2- A/B Test Basics
3- When your sample size is big

Speaker:
Elea McDonnell Feit is an Assistant Professor of Marketing at the LeBow College of Business at Drexel University. She develops data analysis methods to inform marketing decisions including designing new products as well as planning advertising campaigns.

-----

This event will be virtual and accessed via Zoom.

title: R-Ladies Philly: June Virtual Event - Intro to R & Data Science Lighting talk
description:
R-Ladies Philly is pleased to host a virtual data science event to help you get started using R!

Agenda:
6:00: Welcome
6:05-6:20: "6 R Packages to Add to Your Workflow" by Jinyi Kuang
6:20-8:00: Intro to R workshop by Tess Cherlin

About our speakers:
Jinyi Kuang is a research specialist at the Center for Social Norms and Behavioral Dynamics (CSNBD) and a Ph.D. student in Psychology at the University of Pennsylvania. She received a B.S. from the University of Maryland, College Park in 2016. Her research focuses on how people's social beliefs and expectations impact behaviors. Specifically, she is interested in how people perceive what is typical or desirable in a social group, how people make inferences of social information, and how individual differences in these inferences impact judgments and decision makings. She hopes these findings could inform intervention design to nudge people do good. Jinyi is currently working with CSNBD to assess social determinants of sanitation behaviors in India. She will present her recent research and how she uses R for her research workflow.

Tess Cherlin is a PhD student at Thomas Jefferson University in the Genetics, Genomics, and Cancer Biology program and does her research in the Computational Medicine Center. She uses computational and wet lab methods to study small noncoding RNA profiles in health and disease contexts. Tess had no experience with R (or coding) when she began her PhD but has found R to be very learnable and incredibly useful for her data analysis. She looks forward to guiding R-Ladies beginners through a hands-on Intro to R workshop!

title: R-Ladies Brisbane: Virtual presentations - Discover the package gganimate
description:
"gganimate" is an R package that extends the grammar of graphics as implemented by "ggplot2" to include the description of animation.
You can see some examples here: https://github.com/thomasp85/gganimate

Let's welcome Rhetta Chappell the Data Analystics Web Developer for the Regional Innovation Data Lab (RIDL) at Griffith University. She will share with us a short introduction to the gganimate package and a few tips, tricks and examples from her journey into animated plots in R.
This is a short presentation, so get your questions ready! we will aim to get those answered.

If you want to use the packages from this presentation you can install them on the R console:

# install.packages("devtools)
install.packages("tidyverse")
devtools::install_github("thomasp85/gganimate")

We look forward to seeing you virtually, the zoom link will be shared with those who RSVP.

title: R-Ladies Twin Cities: (VIRTUAL) Multilevel Modeling w/ MN Public Salaries Data
description:
It’s easy to get pretty far learning R and basic statistical analysis without really encountering the concept of multilevel modeling. This is unfortunate, because multilevel modeling can be a useful tool when data generating processes are hierarchical in nature--a situation which can be quite common in social, ecological, and political systems.

Alison Link will explore some of the multilevel modeling techniques and philosophies discussed in the book "Statistical Rethinking" by Richard McElreath, and explore how these concepts can be applied to a public salaries dataset on Minnesota state employees. The goal? Learn something new about about multilevel modeling AND generate some interesting findings about Minnesota state employee compensation!

title: R-Ladies Irvine: Introduction to RStudio for Data Mapping + Getting Started with R
description:
# Schedule
Tuesday, May 19th, 6:30-8:30pm
6:30 - [Online Networking Activity] Zoom Breakout Rooms
6:55 - Announcements
7:00 - [Career Corner] Getting Started with R
7:20 - 10-Minute Break
7:30 - [R Time] Introduction to RStudio for Data Mapping
8:30 - Meeting Adjourned

# Meeting Location
Out of an abundance of caution regarding COVID-19 and in order to prioritize the health and safety of everyone who attends our events, the March 17th meeting will be held ONLINE using Zoom.

The meeting link will be sent to registered attendees.
Please use the RSVP button to register!

# Presentations
[Career Corner] Getting Started with R
Speaker: Madeline Bauer, PhD

[R Time] Introduction to RStudio for Data Mapping
Speaker: Echelle Burns
Abstract:
Although RStudio has become very popular among scientists, educators, governments, and industry, the nuances associated with geospatial data continue to give novice and intermediate-level RStudio users headaches. This introduction to geospatial data uses location data collected from flatfish and rockfish in southern California to demonstrate how to use RStudio for basic mapping projects. We will discuss the basics of geospatial data, including what shapefiles are and how to read and display them properly in RStudio, as well as how to use RStudio to answer more advanced questions, such as, “What kind of environments are these fish exposed to?” and “Are these fish using areas close to underwater structures, like artificial reefs?” In general, geospatial data can be used to answer a wider variety of questions and RStudio is particularly useful for displaying trends in these data that may be undetectable by simply looking at values within rows and columns. Let’s get mapping!

# Live-streaming & Meeting Materials
- All registered attendees will receive a Zoom link to join the meeting. Please see the information above.
- All materials will be sent out and posted on our GitHub (https://github.com/rladies-irvine) after the event.
- The recording of the meeting will be sent out and posted on our YouTube Channel (https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCIbS1KNK7jbcbQVNt7lF62A) after the event.

title: R-Ladies Melbourne: Binovisualfields Package: Development and Publication to CRAN
description:
Hi Everyone! We hope you are all safe and well!!

We have been working to move our coming events online, we hope you will all be able to join us. This month we are excited to welcome Virginia Liu who will be telling us about the development of the Binovisualfields package. This package is for simulation and visualisation of depth-dependent binocular visual fields.

Visual fields are measured monocularly at a single depth in clinical practice, yet real-life activities involve predominantly binocular vision at multiple depths. A simulation and visualisation tool that computes binocular visual fields from monocular ones is useful for researchers and clinicians in the field for many purposes. However, no such tool was available. The talk will provide an overview of the development of the R package and its CRAN submission process.

Virginia is a Postdoc researcher at the Optometry and Vision Sciences Department of the University of Melbourne, a self-taught programmer and UX designer. She has a BMedSci and PhD in psychology.

This event will be held online via zoom. Please connect just before 6pm, the seminar will start promptly at 6. When you connect please turn off your microphone.

We look forward to seeing you all there!

R-Ladies Melbourne

title: R-Ladies Oslo: Reports to impress your boss! Rmarkdown magic
description:
Because we are not able to meet for a meetup, and the Statistrikk talk is absolutely best to do in person, we are rescheduling this event to August.
Sign up for it in the postponed event: https://www.meetup.com/rladies-oslo/events/270489627/

In stead we will do a meetup on Rmarkdown online!

Rmarkdown is a specialized type of markdown (rich text format) made for R. It provides the opportunity to combine written text with output from R (or even other programming engines) to create integrated documents. It is great for automating report generation, and can make life easier if you find your self needing to do make the same report with slightly different content or input.

Mo (Athanasia Mowinckel) will do a talk with a simple introduction to Rmarkdown, and how it can be used in different settings like reports, presentations, posters etc.

title: R-Ladies Valparaíso: Taller introductorio: procesamiento y visualización de datos con R (Sesión 2)
description:
El miércoles 13 de mayo continuamos nuestro taller en línea de introducción a R que organizamos en conjunto RLadies Santiago, RLadies Valparaíso y RLadies Concepción. El taller cuatro sesiones (6, 13, 20 y 27 de mayo) y tiene por objetivo revisar los principios básicos para que puedas iniciar tu camino analizando datos con R.
¿Quieres aprender a utilizar R en un ambiente amable e inclusivo? ¡Te esperamos! No es necesario tener ningún conocimiento previo sobre programación.

Esta segunda sesión estará a cargo de Sara Acevedo, estudiante de Doctorado en Ciencias de la Ingeniería, y se enfocará en funciones básicas para el manejo de datos provenientes del paquete {dplyr}.

> ¿Qué necesito para participar?

Lo primero, es leer nuestro nuestro código de conducta. Es requisito para asistir estar de acuerdo con él: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct#spanish
Lo segundo, es crearte una cuenta en RStudio Cloud (https://rstudio.cloud/). Partiremos trabajando en una versión de R en la nube para asegurarnos que todo funciona bien al principio. Más adelante instalaremos R en tu computador.
Lo tercero, es asegurarte que puedes utilizar la aplicación Zoom en tu computador. El día del taller te enviaremos el enlace para unirte (chequea ese día que el mensaje no se haya ido a la carpeta de spam).
El taller tiene cupos limitados por la plataforma que usaremos y se asignarán por orden de llegada a las personas inscritas. Te pedimos disculpas desde ya si es que el día del taller tratas de conectarte y los cupos ya están llenos :( Es muy difícil estimar la audiencia real en eventos gratuitos.

> ¿Al inscribirme ahora me estoy anotando para las cuatro sesiones?

No. Agendaremos un nuevo evento acá en Meetup para cada sesión. Lo hacemos así porque nos permite organizarnos mejor.

¡Te esperamos!

title: R-Ladies Baltimore: R-Ladies Baltimore -- Leveraging Python in R using the reticulate package
description:
R-Ladies Baltimore (Bmore) is the local Baltimore chapter for the larger R-Ladies global organization (rladies.org) to promote gender diversity in the R community.

We will have an event on Thursday May 28, 2020 from 5:30-7pm at Allovue (https://allovue.com). We will have presentations on how to leverage Python in R using the 'reticulate' R package!

WHO is this for?
- If you are new to R & are short-budgeted on time!
- If you know and love Python, but want to know how to use in R!
- If you just want to see some awesome examples of leveraging Python packages in R!

*If any/all of this is true, this event might be for you!*

Reticulate provides a comprehensive set of tools for interoperability between Python and R. The package includes facilities for:

* Calling Python from R in a variety of ways including R Markdown, sourcing Python scripts, importing Python modules, and using Python interactively within an R session.

* Translation between R and Python objects (for example, between R and Pandas data frames, or between R matrices and NumPy arrays).

* Flexible binding to different versions of Python including virtual environments and Conda environments.

Reticulate embeds a Python session within your R session, enabling seamless, high-performance interoperability. If you are an R developer that uses Python for some of your work or a member of data science team that uses both languages, reticulate can dramatically streamline your workflow!

AGENDA
5:30–5:45 Meet & Greet | 🍪 | Networking
5:45–5:50 Who we are | Announcements | What's next
5:50–6:30 Presentation: What are Shiny Apps and how can you build one?

Please help us by spreading the word about R-Ladies. Please also take the time to review our code of conduct before you attend: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct

The term "women and gender minorities" is inclusive of individuals who identify as female (trans and cis), trans-men, non-binary, genderqueer, genderfluid, agender, intersex, and all minority genders).

title: R-Ladies Washington D.C.: Introduction to COVID19 data visualization using tidyverse packages in R
description:
Dr. Wall will share with us her work using R’s tidyverse packages to visualize COVID-19 data. At this event she will show us how to:

-import the data sets from the nytimes and Johns Hopkins github pages (readr)
-tidy them (tidyr)
-visualize the countries or states with the highest number of confirmed cases (ggplot & dplyr)
-apply a sigmoid model to the provinces of China storing them in a nested dataframe
-use broom to look at the parameters for each of those models

Bio: Dr. Jane Wall had extensive software industry experience before earning her PhD at Rice University in computational and applied mathematics. She initiated American University’s data science program, teaches R and Data Science, is director of data science programs and is co-director of the Masters degree in data science at American University.

title: R-Ladies Washington D.C.: Books In Bars - Braiding sweetgrass
description:
Spend Friday night discussing Braiding Sweetgrass (https://www.amazon.com/Braiding-Sweetgrass-Indigenous-Scientific-Knowledge-ebook/dp/B00D0V44LC).

As a botanist, Robin Wall Kimmerer has been trained to ask questions of nature with the tools of science. As a member of the Citizen Potawatomi Nation, she embraces the notion that plants and animals are our oldest teachers. In Braiding Sweetgrass, Kimmerer brings these two lenses of knowledge together to take us on “a journey that is every bit as mythic as it is scientific, as sacred as it is historical, as clever as it is wise” (Elizabeth Gilbert).

Drawing on her life as an indigenous scientist, and as a woman, Kimmerer shows how other living beings—asters and goldenrod, strawberries and squash, salamanders, algae, and sweetgrass—offer us gifts and lessons, even if we've forgotten how to hear their voices. In reflections that range from the creation of Turtle Island to the forces that threaten its flourishing today, she circles toward a central argument: that the awakening of ecological consciousness requires the acknowledgment and celebration of our reciprocal relationship with the rest of the living world. For only when we can hear the languages of other beings will we be capable of understanding the generosity of the earth, and learn to give our own gifts in return.

PS Please contact the organizer if you need support finding the book.

title: Dublin R: Why R? Webinar -  Scalable Automatic Machine Learning in R with H2O AutoML
description:
Speaker: Erin Ledell
Title: Scalable Automatic Machine Learning in R with H2O AutoML

- channel: youtube.com/c/WhyRFoundation
- date: every Thursday 7:00 pm (Irish Summer Time)
- format: one 45 minutes long stream + 10 minutes for Q&A
- comments: ask questions on YouTube live chat
- join Why R? Slack whyr.pl/slack/
- LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/company/why-r
- Twitter: https://twitter.com/whyrconf/

Abstract:

The focus of this presentation is scalable and automatic machine learning in R using the H2O machine learning platform. H2O is an open source, distributed machine learning platform is designed to scale to very large datasets that may not fit into RAM on a single machine. We will provide a brief overview of the field of Automatic Machine Learning, followed by a detailed look inside H2O's AutoML algorithm. H2O AutoML provides an easy-to-use interface which automates data pre-processing, training and tuning a large selection of candidate models (including multiple stacked ensemble models for superior model performance), and due to the distributed nature of the H2O platform, H2O AutoML can scale to very large datasets. The result of the AutoML run is a "leaderboard" of H2O models which can be easily exported for use in production.

Biography
Dr. LeDell is the Chief Machine Learning Scientist at H2O.ai, the company that produces the open source, distributed machine learning platform, H2O. Before joining H2O.ai, she was the Principal Data Scientist at two AI startups (both acquired), the founder of DataScientific, Inc. and a software engineer at a large consulting firm. She received her Ph.D. from UC Berkeley where her research focused on machine learning and computational statistics. She also holds a B.S. and M.A. in Mathematics. Erin has founded Women+ in Machine Learning & Data Science and co-founded R-Ladies Global.

title: R-Ladies RTP: [ONLINE] #tidytuesday Work Group
description:
Join fellow R-Ladies in exploring a #tidytuesday data set! For those craving human connection and some practice flexing your data science skills, this is the event for you! We will hold our May networking event via Zoom, where you can meet other R-ladies, improve your R skills, and build your data science portfolio.

This month we will be analyzing the PoKi: Poems by Kids dataset. This will be a great chance to practice text analysis for those of us who are more accustomed to quantitative analysis. https://github.com/whipson/PoKi-Poems-by-Kids

Agenda:
7:00 - 7:15 pm Meet & Greet
7:15 - 8:30 pm #tidytuesday
8:30 - 9:00 pm Discussion

What is #tidytuesday?
#TidyTuesday is a weekly social data project created by the R4DS online learning community that is focused on using tidyverse packages. A new data set and accompanying article featuring an interesting plot is released on Github every Monday. The goal is to generate a copy of the original plot or create your own original approach!

For more information on #tidytuesday, check out this blog post: https://bit.ly/2HqEsdt

Who is this for?
New and experienced R users alike! Let's learn together! All are welcome, including R-Ladies RTP members and R-Ladies from around the world.

What should I bring?
You'll need a computer with videoconferencing capabilities and R. Serve yourself a cozy beverage and a snack to fuel your evening!

Where will it take place?
**Please join us online via Zoom.** A link to join will be provided when you RSVP.

All events are intended for women as leaders, mentors, members, and attendees. We are emphatically queer and trans friendly. Men are welcomed to attend *as guests* and must be accompanied by the R-Lady who invited them. This group was created so those who identify as women have a comfortable place to learn. If you would like to attend and feel excluded, please introduce yourself to an organizer.

title: R-Ladies Los Angeles: RLadies LA May Virtual Meetup: Writing Functions!
description:
Hello RLadies!

We're back for another virtual meetup! Katie Leap will be giving a workshop about writing functions. We'll discuss when you need to write a function, how they're written, how to find functions that already exist, how to adapt code into functions, and how to use the ideas behind functional programming to make your life easier.

Have a question about functions that you'd like Katie to cover? Post a comment on the event page!

The Zoom link is available once you RSVP. All materials from the tutorial will be available on Github afterward.

As always we welcome people regardless of gender, but our group is intended for those who identify with a gender minority (trans women, cis women, trans men, non-binary, other). We expect all attendees to abide by our Code of Conduct.

See you there!
Katie Leap
@katie_leap

PS: We're always looking for presenters! If you're interested, please reach out to Amanda ([masked]) or Katie ([masked]).

title: R-Ladies Dallas: Data Analysis with R (Part 2 of 3)
description:
I'm excited about our plan to enhance our programming skills through an online learning experience. As a group, we decided that we will focus on the "Data Analysis with R" course taught by Facebook instructors on the Udacity learning platform. This will ensure that we are all on the same page when we're ready to kick off our R-Ladies Dallas group project.

The course is available for free at the following link: https://www.udacity.com/course/data-analysis-with-r--ud651

Please join the #learning channel in our R-Ladies Dallas Slack community so that we can discuss the course and ask/answer questions you may have about the material. Slack sign-up info provided below.

Agenda
------------------------------
Part 1: Lessons 1 - 4
Part 2: Lessons 5 - 8 < -------- this meetup event
Part 3: Lessons 9 - 10

To prepare for the event, please take time to watch the videos and work through the exercises. They estimate that it may take you up to 12 hours to complete the videos and exercises in Part 2 (Lessons 5 - 8). Actual completion time could be lower depending on how much experience you have with some of the concepts.

You are encouraged to click the link below to keep up with the webinar series and to join the Slack community. Slack is a messaging platform where we will share open job opportunities, free or low-cost online training materials, and R-Ladies group projects that will help you practice your R programming skills and develop a portfolio that could be used to showcase your skills to hiring managers.

Webinar + Slack sign-up: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdJhvSg-YrNYOrmju1yrXvYhFM7xMey1WpDq1NSGIp6x41VaA/viewform

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

About R-Ladies Dallas

R-Ladies Dallas welcomes members of all R proficiency levels, whether you're a new or aspiring R user, or an experienced R programmer interested in mentoring, networking & expert upskilling. Our non-profit, civil society community is designed to develop our members' R skills & knowledge through social, collaborative learning & sharing. Supporting minority identity access to STEM skills & careers, the Free Software Movement, and contributing to the global R community!

A local chapter of R-Ladies Global, R-Ladies Dallas exists to promote gender diversity in the R community worldwide. We are pro-actively inclusive of queer, trans, and all minority identities, with additional sensitivity to intersectional identities. Our priority is to provide a safe community space for anyone identifying as a minority gender who is interested in and/or working with R. As a founding principle, there is no cost or charge to participate in any of our R-Ladies communities around the world.

Q: Are men welcome to attend R-Ladies events?
A: Yes, men are welcome at this event. Our mission is to encourage more women and non-binary individuals to get involved in the R community. Please help us by spreading the word about R-Ladies, and by being respectful of the fact that this event is primarily for women/non-binary/female-identifying individuals.

We expect all attendees to abide & be governed by our community code of conduct. Please take a moment to review our R-Ladies Global code of conduct (particularly if this is your first time attending!): https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct.

title: R-Ladies São Paulo: [MeetUp Online] Do SQL para o R em minutos
description:
SQL (Structured Query Language) é uma das linguagens mais difundidas quando se trata de bancos de dados. Então, pensamos nesse MeetUp especialmente para você que está começando a mexer com bancos de dados: dobradinha SQL Básico + R.

Público-alvo: pessoas que se identificam como minoria de gênero (mulher trans ou cis, homem trans, pessoa não-binária, queer).

Por favor leia todas as informações abaixo!

• CRONOGRAMA:
14:00 - 14:15: Apresentação do RLadies e explicação de como funcionará o MeetUp
14:15 - 14:45: Apresentação da Adriana Leticia sobre SQL básico
14:45 - 14:55: Esclarecimentos de dúvidas
14:55 - 15:10: intervalo
15:10 - 15:15: Retomada dos combinados
15:15 - 15:45: Apresentação da Maria Marinho sobre SQL → R
15:45 - 15:55: Esclarecimentos de dúvidas
15:55 - 16:00: Feed-back de participantes

Monitoria: será online via chat

• LOCAL DO EVENTO:
Será usada a ferramenta Jitsi, link será enviado por email no dia anterior, portanto, preencham o email de vocês na inscrição.

• O QUE PRECISO FAZER PARA PARTICIPAR?
- Se inscrever pelo site do Meetup gratuitamente, incluindo seu nome completo e email— esses dados não serão divulgados publicamente
- Ler o código de conduta (mais detalhes abaixo)
- Se possível, instalar em seu notebook os programas R e RStudio ANTES do curso: https://www.curso-r.com/material/instalacao/
- Vontade de aprender SQL e R em um ambiente inclusivo, amistoso e seguro :)

• CÓDIGO DE CONDUTA (disponível aqui: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct)
Qualquer pessoa que violar ou houver previamente violado o código de conduta desta comunidade terá sua entrada proibida, será expulsa/o e/ou estará sujeita/o à ação que a pessoa organizadora achar mais apropriada, independente de inscrição no evento, ser membro do MeetUp ou qualquer outra condição.

_____________________________________________
• PALESTRANTES

Adriana Leticia Reis
Bacharel em Sistemas de Informação pelo Mackenzie com MBA em Finanças pela FGV e atualmente está cursando a segunda graduação em Ciência de Dados na Univesp. Trabalha há 15 anos na Vivo, sempre atuando com Business Intelligence em diferentes áreas como Data Warehouse, Controladoria, Estratégia e atualmente em Planejamento de Marketing B2C Móvel. Ama tocar piano, gatos (tem dois) e claro ficar com a família.

Maria Marinho dos Santos
Formada em Processamento de Dados, bacharela e licenciada em Matemática, pós graduada em Educação Matemática. Atualmente é Cientista de Dados na SulAmérica e faz parte das comunidades R-Ladies e PyLadies São Paulo.

_____________________________________________
• SOBRE AS R-LADIES
R-Ladies é uma organização que promove a diversidade de gênero na comunidade da linguagem R. Nosso principal objetivo é promover a linguagem computacional estatística R compartilhando conhecimento, assim, quem tiver interesse na linguagem será bem-vinda, independente do nível de conhecimento. Nosso principal público-alvo são as pessoas que se identificam com o gênero feminino, portanto, mulheres cis, mulheres trans, bem como pessoas não-binárias e queer.

_____________________________________________
O curso é gratuito, mas as vagas são limitadas.
Seja consciente e só se inscreva se puder comparecer ao evento.

title: R-Ladies Den Bosch: R Ladies Netherlands Book Club - Advanced R - Chapter 4 Subsetting
description:
The R Ladies chapters of the Netherlands are partnering up!

Starting in April, we are hosting an online book club. Our first book is Hadley Wickham's Advanced R (https://adv-r.hadley.nz/).

In our third meeting, Martine Jansen from R Ladies Den Bosch will present the key points of Chapter 4: "Subsetting". After that, we'll try an exercise together and help each other clear up any doubts and get over any hurdles :) Make sure to read the chapter in advance!

The link to the event meeting will be provided closer to the date.

Online meetings will take place every two weeks. Check the full schedule, previous slides and sign up to present a chapter at this link https://rladiesnl.github.io/book_club/ !

See you soon and stay safe!

title: R-Ladies Concepción: Funciones básicas para el manejo de datos
description:
El miércoles 13 de mayo continuamos nuestro taller en línea de introducción a R que organizamos en conjunto RLadies Santiago, RLadies Valparaíso y RLadies Concepción. El taller cuatro sesiones (6, 13, 20 y 27 de mayo) y tiene por objetivo revisar los principios básicos para que puedas iniciar tu camino analizando datos con R.
¿Quieres aprender a utilizar R en un ambiente amable e inclusivo? ¡Te esperamos! No es necesario tener ningún conocimiento previo sobre programación.

> ¿Qué necesito para participar?

Lo primero, es leer nuestro nuestro código de conducta. Es requisito para asistir estar de acuerdo con él: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct#spanish
Lo segundo, es crearte una cuenta en RStudio Cloud (https://rstudio.cloud/). Partiremos trabajando en una versión de R en la nube para asegurarnos que todo funciona bien al principio. Más adelante instalaremos R en tu computador.
Lo tercero, es asegurarte que puedes utilizar la aplicación Zoom en tu computador. El día del taller te enviaremos el enlace para unirte (chequea ese día que el mensaje no se haya ido a la carpeta de spam).
El taller tiene cupos limitados por la plataforma que usaremos y se asignarán por orden de llegada a las personas inscritas. Te pedimos disculpas desde ya si es que el día del taller tratas de conectarte y los cupos ya están llenos :( Es muy difícil estimar la audiencia real en eventos gratuitos.

> ¿Al inscribirme ahora me estoy anotando para las cuatro sesiones?

No. Agendaremos un nuevo evento acá en Meetup para cada sesión. Lo hacemos así porque nos permite organizarnos mejor.

¡Te esperamos!

title: R-Ladies Concepción: Calendarización usando ggplot2
description:
En el segundo taller especializado de mayo Javiera Riffo nos mostrará aplicaciones del paquete ggplot2. Luego de hacer una revisión de los conceptos esenciales de visualización con este paquete, nos mostrará cómo generar gráficas para calendarizar nuestros datos.

Javiera Riffo es Ingeniera Matemática y actualmente cursa el Magíster en Ingeniería PUC.

Lo primero, es leer nuestro código de conducta. Es requisito para asistir estar de acuerdo con él: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct#spanish
